intro.paragraph_1: We see the protection of personal data as a very important part of our business operations and services. Protecting this data is the foundation of our reliability as a supplier and partner. By personal data we mean in this case: all information about an identified and/or identifiable natural person.
intro.paragraph_2: In this privacy statement you can read about the personal data that we collect from you. We collect this information because we have an agreement with you or are in contact with you about our services and products.
intro.paragraph_3: In this statement you can read:
intro.item_2: how long we keep personal data
intro.item_3: how you can view and modify the personal data we hold on you
intro.item_4: how your personal data is protected with us

promises.title: Our Privacy Promises
promises.subtitle: Our privacy promises are defined by the following rules of thumb:

purpose.title: Purpose determination and purpose limitation
purpose.description: We only use personal data for explicitly defined and justified purposes.

basis.title: Basis
basis.description: We base the processing of personal data on a legal base.

minimization.title: Data minimization
minimization.description: When processing personal data, we ensure that the amount of data remains limited.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: We account transparently to those involved, such as citizens, suppliers, and employees of the municipality, about the use of their personal data.

safety.title: Safety
safety.description: We take privacy seriously. In every choice we make, we take measures to protect privacy as much as possible.

security.title: Personal Data Security
security.description: We do our utmost best to handle personal data with the utmost care. We also do everything in our power to protect this data against loss and/or any form of unlawful use or processing. We use appropriate technical and organizational measures, for example of the latest innovations in security. If we have to share your personal data with third parties in order to carry out its tasks, we make agreements for this purpose.

breach.title: Security Breach
breach.paragraph_1: Despite all our efforts, if a security breach happens, we will deal with such an incident in accordance with an internal procedure drawn up for this purpose. In the case of a security breach, we will do everything in our power to minimize the consequences of the breach.
breach.paragraph_2: If the breach constitutes a privacy risk, we will report this to the Dutch Authority of Personal Data (Autoriteit Persoonsgegevens). If it is desirable - and in any case the law requires it - we will also inform those concerned about the breach.

rights.title: What Are Your Rights?
rights.subtitle: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR, in Dutch: Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming or AGV), you have the following rights:

access.title: Access
access.description: You have the right to view the personal data that we process about you.

correction.title: Correction and supplementation
correction.description: You have the right to have your personal data processed by us to be changed.

forgotten.title: Be forgotten
forgotten.description: You have the right to have your personal data deleted.

portability.title: Data portability
portability.description: You have the right to have personal data transferred from us to another party.

restriction.title: Restriction of processing
restriction.description: You have the right to have less data processed by us.

automated.title: Automated decision-making and profiling
automated.description: You have the right to a human opinion when making decisions that we make (as opposed to automated decision-making).

objection.title: Objection
objection.description: You have the right to object to data processing with us.

contact.title: How Do You Exercise Your Rights?
contact.description: We take the privacy of your personal data very seriously. That's why we have appointed a privacy officer who handles all your questions about privacy rights.

complaint.title: The Right to File a Complaint
complaint.description: We handle your data as transparently and carefully as possible. If you do have a complaint about the processing of your data, please contact our privacy officer first by sending a message to info@gemeentepassensen.eu. We will then do our utmost to resolve your complaint. If you unexpectedly do not agree with the measure taken, please contact the Dutch Authority of Personal Data (Autoriteit Persoonsgegevens).

info_sheet.title: Information Sheet Per Data Processing
info_sheet.subtitle: In addition to the privacy statement, we have opted to draw up an information sheet for specific processing/parts. This information sheet specifically addresses the following sub-topics:
info_sheet.item_1: Why do we use your personal data?
info_sheet.item_2: What types of personal data do we process?
info_sheet.item_3: Who has access to your personal data?
info_sheet.item_4: What is the legal basis for the processing of your personal data?
info_sheet.item_5: How long do we keep your data?
info_sheet.item_6: Which security measures are in place?
